website_summaries.verdict: The Dell V515w is a capable printer with all-in-one print, fax, scan, and copy functionality, but the cheap build, quick-depleting cartridges, and spotty wireless service aren't worth the hassle. We recommend skipping over this ink guzzler and picking up a more reputable multifunction inkjet.
cons: prone to paper jams due to low-output tray capacity

customer_reviews.title: to get it to work properly I had to call ...
customer_reviews.text: to get it to work properly I had to call Dell and pay an another $99.00 I should of just went to dell and bought as usual
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINE

customer_reviews.title: The Dell piece of garbage that I purchased from your vendor did not work ...
customer_reviews.text: The Dell piece of garbage that I purchased from your vendor did not work even after I purchase the parts recommended. Never again. Thanks for wasting my money.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Perez

customer_reviews.title: Dell All-in-One Wireless Printer (V515w)
customer_reviews.text: I love this dell printer, I do not have any problems with it. You can purchase ink from Staples, Office depot, or Amazon much cheaper than Dell. Also, I was able to connect it to my laptop with the inclosed CD and cable cords. Great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Stephie L

customer_reviews.title: Nellie's opinion
customer_reviews.text: I have found the Dell All-in-One wireless printer very usuable and with lots of support. Once in a while, the print head gets stuck but that's easily fixed by opening the printer head compartment and closing it again. The printer works well with my Dell studio xps computer.
customer_reviews.author: ner

customer_reviews.title: Dell V515w
customer_reviews.text: The printer was easy to set up and prints good quality. I did need help from Dell to get the start page icon to operate correctly. It needed a software upgrade for windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Ron E

customer_reviews.title: Big piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine directly from Dell. It is the worst printer I've ever used. It prints very little before requiring a new cartridge. I don't print a lot and even bought the supposed high yield ones. It stopped communicating with my PC for no apparent reason. I can't use it wirelessly . If I don't have the USB plugged in, it doesn't work. I have wasted many hours of my life on the phone with Dell trying to resolve the issues. I will take great delight in smashing the stuffing out of this as I am done and am getting a new higher rated printer. You have been warned. Don't take it even if someone offers it for free.
customer_reviews.author: P S

customer_reviews.title: Like literally -- I print one document and then the ...
customer_reviews.text: I despise this printer with all my heart and soul. No matter how many times I set it up, it always forgets how to communicate with my computer between print jobs. Like literally -- I print one document and then the next one won't print. I am mystified. I know this is now old news, but I literally am just so angry about this total piece of crap that I paid $300 for back when I bought my computer that I had to vent somewhere. THIS PRINTER SUCKS. Truly. I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nordstrom

customer_reviews.title: It Worked Great for Me
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about 4 years and it has been a great printer. Wireless setup was easy, print quality good - no complaints until lately. When I put in a new cartridge (generic), I get a message that there is no black ink. I took it apart, cleaned the printhead, etc. to no avail. Could be from software updates it will not allow anything but Dell cartridges now and they are not easy to find except online. Otherwise this has been an excellent printer for home use.
customer_reviews.author: 4OSUKIDS

customer_reviews.title: Hate This Printer. Hate, Hate, Hate.
customer_reviews.text: When it prints it's marginally okay for plain black and white text but print quality is generally poor and streaky. Haven't been able to print enough to personally determine the amount of ink it uses. Most of the time I get a "requires troubleshooting error." It's connected to the wireless network, but nothing will print. Stuff just piles up in the printer queue no matter what I do. Most frustrating piece of technology I have ever owned. Finally gave up on the wireless and re-arranged things so I can plug in a USB cable. Won't print from a card or thumb drive. Endlessly enters the "preparing printer" state.
customer_reviews.author: MonaLS

customer_reviews.title: The worst printer EVER.
customer_reviews.text: I received my second replacement printer today (total of 3 of these printers). After printing only a few pages of a Word document, there were red and blue smears all over the pages. Dell will not admit that there is a design flaw even though all three printers did the exact same thing. They said I inserted the cartridges improperly. Not true, although the printer head which contains the cartridges is poorly made and fragile. I bought a Brother printer and not only can I find the ink without having to order it through the internet, the ink lasts much longer. I will never buy another Dell printer. They also refuse to give me my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A piece of caca.  Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Pros: None Cons: Expensive ink cartridges Repeated failures to communicate with computer I have this stupid thing for 2 years and hate it with a passion. I re-installed the driver so many times it's not even funny. The printer was made by Lexmark and re-packaged as Dell's. Had I known, I would not even touch this piece of junk. Conclusion: Stay away. Don't buy it. If you did then trash it TODAY! If only....I could give it a negative 100 stars, I would!
customer_reviews.author: Gocker V.

customer_reviews.title: Worse printer I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the wireless. Problem is every power glitch, brownout, etc it loses the network settings. It seems I have to reprogram it every other time I want to use it. Also printer cartridges cost per page is about 4 times what the canon printer I have, which the V515W was bought to replace. So instead I using the newer network v515W, I bought a network to USB converter for the canon printer for $20 and the V515W is gathering dust in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Dell
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it a zero I would. I contacted Dell while the product was under warranty to get help. They actually stalled with providing help until the product was out of warranty. Even after going through the Better Business Bureau after a year and a half of fighting they finally offered a $50 coupon or phone support. I have used their phone support and it is not very helpful. Every attempt I make to contact headquarters either goes without a response or gets sent back to the Customer Service Arm. It is as if Dell has washed their hands of their customer service group. There is no accountability for their products or their service.
customer_reviews.author: ADBEST

customer_reviews.title: dell is giving it away for free
customer_reviews.text: Giving away for free for a reason, its a wireless piece of junk. I received one free with my purchase of a touch screen dell computer and its a joke. Had trouble catching paper from the moment I got it. Takes forever to load print applications when using the wireless setting and the printer connection both wireless and usbs will often timeout and you have to restart the machine.. if I were u I wouldn't save a buck for this nice looking junk.
customer_reviews.author: viqueHAT

customer_reviews.title: Believe every single one star review!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought a new computer from Dell, I also purchased this printer for 75 bucks, and thought it quite a deal. That is until I tried to use it. I filled up the paper tray, checked that everything was set properly, then hit print. Nothing happened and the screen notified me, that I had failed to put in paper. I tried for a good half hour to get the printer to grab for the paper, but it never happened. The icing on the cake is that the computer isn't any more dependable than the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Shadow

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment in just about every way
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this printer for about a year and have been only disappointed by it. Let me break it down: *Wireless connectivity--printing wirelessly consistently crashes by wireless network. *Fax--The fax software consistently fails to successfully fax a document or image. *Print--Requires frequent updates of the firmware/software or the printer cannot communicate with my PC. SAVE YOUR MONEY for a different machine. This one is a complete failure.
customer_reviews.author: sfmiguelito

customer_reviews.title: Absolutley the worst printer ever!
customer_reviews.text: This stupid thing stinks! It is just a gigantic paperweight since it will not print anything. It keeps trying to tell me that I haven't put in any paper, but in reality I've loaded the stupid thing 42 times! I've tried cleaning the rollers, re-loading the paper, cleaning the rollers again, loading the paper again, maybe different paper this time, NOTHING WORKS. I'm going to take it out back and recreate that scene from Office Space. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Alter Ego

customer_reviews.title: Dell V515 not the best of them
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Dell V-505 then had ink replacement errors. After fighting with dell for almost a year they sent me a replacement the dell V-515 and said this is a top of the line replacement so now after 1 year same problem when the ink goes and goes very fast, and you replace the ink it fails to work. I still have my Gateway from 1993 works good but old programs key word still works. Bottom line I am not very happy with DELL products right now
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRINTER EVER
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about 2 years ago, worked "wirelessly" for about a month. Than it would say "NOT ABLE TO COMMUNICATE WITH PRINTER", would have to reboot, only to have it still not print, but then when you turn the computer off, it would somtimes print. Would have to uninstall or use usb to print. Dell customer support was terrible, will never buy DELL printer again. I am using caps to yell at you to "DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER, IT SUCKS"
customer_reviews.author: JMD

customer_reviews.title: Poor Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this printer with a new desktop. Possibly the worst printer I have ever purchased. It runs through ink incredibly quickly even for an inkjet. It also has a somewhat uniquely bad problem with the print head drying up and blank pages being printed. The printer is easy enough to use and set up but it's actual utility as a printer is limited. Save yourself time and money by purchasing a better printer. I don't know if I trust Dell's inkjet printer line anymore.
customer_reviews.author: T. Verghese

customer_reviews.title: The Worst Printer on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this printer. My Dad bought one. I have, and you will, spend evenings trying to delete print jobs and establishing a connection with the laptop. No one at Dell can help. The advice you will receive after hours on the phone will be to unplug everything, plug everything back in and see if that helps. It will not. Even a professional computer installation company gave up. You have been warned. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. Dell will soon take it off the market and act like it never existed. Amazon should be ashamed to carry a product like this. One star is being kind.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Horrible printer. The wireless option rarely works
customer_reviews.text: Horrible printer. The wireless option rarely works. If I'm lucky it will print one time and I will try again and it won't work. I even have a usb cable hooked up to it if the wireless option fails and half the time a direct cable from my computer to the printer won't even work. It will say "No connection available" We have calibrated it 3 times and still nothing. It also uses lots of ink. It's very frustrating when my wife and I are trying to print off college papers and it fails at a moment in need when assignments are due. I want to throw it out the window!!! Useless garbage
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: DELL V515w printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer came along FREE when my son purchased his new computer. Since he didn't need the printer and mine was old, he gave it to me. After reading the reviews, I now know why DELL was giving them away. It appears to be the only way they will get rid of them! Sure looks like the ink usage is going to be a pain and the catridges don't appear cheap. For FREE I can readily throw it out and buy what is better rated, but for now is working OK. Does anyone know if compatible cartridges work in these things or stay away??? Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Countrygal

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't connect to network
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the "red" version of the printer with my last laptop purchase to upgrade my home to a wireless printer. I spent about 8 hours trying to connect it to my Wi Fi, but nothing worked even though all troubleshooter said everything was hunky dory. Returned it, purchased a Kodak, and connected automatically in 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Audreypuppy

customer_reviews.title: INK ripoff scheme
customer_reviews.text: I have the next step up in this printer, the V715w. I had to buy it because when I bought a newer dell computer to replace my dying laptop, the old dell printer was not compatible!! So, this new printer will not print in black and white if you don't have a color cartridge with ink in it. I don't want to print in color. This is a total rip off. My next purchase will not be Dell.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: not even good for a paper weight
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer as part of a deal with my Dell desktop and it's the worst printer I have even had. Very hard to connect via wireless, as you have to restart it 3-4 times to get it to connect and the print quality is only so-so best thing about it is the scanner. Even if this printer was a freebie it wouldn't be worth having... oh, and Dell doesn't care......
customer_reviews.author: Rabid reader

customer_reviews.title: How can Dell sell such garbage?!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased this printer about 6 months ago and we haven't had 1 month where something wasn't wrong. It's now sitting on my desk and I use it as a paper weight because the printer head is now bad. We barely even used it and it's already requiring a new printer head! I called DELL Customer Service and they wanted to charge me for help...I told the guy I've had it for 6-months and he said try wiping the printer head down with a coffee filter and see if that works? Unfortunately, it didn't...So, if anyone would like to purchase this printer for .05 please let me know...I'll never purchase another DELL product again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Dytrt

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Dell V715w with new, expensive XPS Dell computer. The Dell v715w uses more ink than I thought was even possible, and is definitely not worth wasting your hard earned cash on. Am looking into HP, at least those printers lasted and worked properly. Save yourself a lot of aggrevation and do not buy one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worst printer ever
customer_reviews.text: Everyone on here is 100% right, I just replaced the cartridges, ran 3 (Literrally 3 i'm not exagerating) "clean print head" tests and it's at 20% ink. You can't refill because of some sort of proprietary software in the cartridge itself. The wi-fi NEVER works properly. TRASH. do not buy this product. Whats more with DELLS complete crap customer service forget about any help from them. I love Dell pc's and laptops so i'm not DELL biased. I would never purchase a dell printer again.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Horrible printer.  Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Print cartridges last about 1 week. It developed issues connecting with my laptop. I HATE it. Run away fast.
customer_reviews.author: hrndnwmn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Printer
customer_reviews.text: In many ways this printer is fairly typical of the "all in one" home variety. The ink cartridges cost too much, but you get lots of functions rolled into one appliance. However the wireless feature is completely terrible and makes the printer almost entirely useless. As several other reviews have noted, frequent reboots of computers and the printer are required on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Daniel Tobin sums it up
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, it doesn't get any worse than this: * terrible print jobs * ink runs out fast * cannot find ink anywhere * constantly have to restart our computers to get it to work * wireless rarely works * frequent error messages * slow print jobs
customer_reviews.author: novalin

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are in a condo and both have Dell laptops. I was looking for a single multipurpose printer/scanner that could be accessed by both our laptops without wires. I bought the V515w 3 years ago, hooked it up with the software package and it's performed wonderfully since. To take care of the ink usage, I set the ink quality on "quick print" and we get 3 to 6 months of printing out of the print cartridges printing several times a day. We also have wedding pictures that were taken 23 years ago that we are scanning into our laptops so they can be shared with people who were not at out wedding.
customer_reviews.author: David L. George

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever!
customer_reviews.text: 1. blurry prints 2. Extensive use of ink - 10 pages and ink is empty 3. does often request a reboot of pc whenhaving been in sleep mode 4. does not react to print order 5. paper jams 6. when color ink is empty, printer blocks completely - neither black&white prints, nor fax or scanning or copying. 7. And these are just the top 6 of troubles you have with this printer. Never again. What this printer does for Dell: Harming their image serverly. They should recall it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonkundin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer IF properly installed
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer a few weeks ago and it is excellent! I can print from anywhere with my laptop. It does take some time to set it up properly, but if you follow the directions its actually very simple! The ink is not as expensive as other printers and it does everything!
customer_reviews.author: Zeus

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable due to printhead problems
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fine when it is working. Unfortunately it has recurring printhead errors which put it totally out of commission. I have previously owned 2 Dell all one in printers which worked for years without any problems. I have had this printer for less than one year, and the printheads have had to be replaced twice already. You can spend hours trying to troubleshoot and clean the printheads, and nothing works. There is a serious design flaw with these printheads. Other than that I found that everything works fine, although it is prone to printer jams.
customer_reviews.author: Appolonia

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer ever.....
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but problems getting it to just print. Had to replace the several components before the first year. I have printed less than 500 pages and the printer stopped working again. I called Dell and they wanted to charge me $89 to try and help me since it is past the one year warranty. When I said I had this problem before and it's re-occurring, the rep said "this product has had problem and recommended you buy another printer". Wow!! I think we should do a class action lawsuit against Dell for a faulty printer. This printer is truly a "LEMON".
customer_reviews.author: Tyrel

customer_reviews.title: My Dell V515 printer is the bottono f the barrel
customer_reviews.text: I have had many Dell products over the years and have been satisfied. However, the DellV515w that I got a few years ago is the WORST printer I have ever had. It has constant problems. We paid for Dell support to help us fix the problems, but after that they soon returned. It is constantly giving me messages about why it cannot print. My husband is a computer DBA and he is frustrated with it. We got so sick and tired of it that we are throwing it out, getting a printer from a different company, and I plan never to buy a Dell printer again.
customer_reviews.author: lion

customer_reviews.title: So unhappy
customer_reviews.text: This printer seems great on the surface, but it is more trouble than it is worth. The wireless feature is always having problems, requiring me to carry my laptop over to the printer and reconnect the USB cable. Basically, I have to re-install the printer every couple of months. Also, it uses up ink like crazy . For regular print jobs, there is no "quick print" option, so you always have to use a lot of ink. Now, after less than a year of use, the printhead needs to be replaced, which goes for about $70. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRINTER!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect easily with WiFi Worse
customer_reviews.text: Used twice Ink is out ! Does not connect easily with WiFi Worse .. Dell is not for me any more they have not improved their product.
customer_reviews.author: Music diva

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money, worthless garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The print heads are constantly going bad. Have been through 2 and I need a third after 2 years of suffering. The software is not compatible with windows 7. It looses connection if you try to print to it and it is in sleep mode, which requires rebooting the computer to regain connection, which this printer came in a package deal from dell. Don't ever buy Dell stuff. The ink cartridges do not last as long as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Kent

customer_reviews.title: INK HOG! Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the others who said that it uses too much ink. Printed about 30 pages and went through a high capacity ink cartridge. Won't print if both cartridges aren't full. GIANT. Takes up too much space. The Dell ink cartridges cost more than half of the cost of the printer! Wireless connectivity is awesome but definitely not worth the aggravation. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dell is a scam machine
customer_reviews.text: This printer is mediocre; however, the worst part is that you have to constantly purchase their order-only ink. Not only does Dell force the users to purchase both color and black ink before either is empty, the printer will not print unless both sources of ink are full enough to fit its standards. I am unfortunately about to throw away a color cartridge full of ink just to replace it with another expensive new color cartridge just so I can print in BLACK AND WHITE ONLY! THANKS DELL FOR A HORRIBLE REPRESENTATION OF TECHNOLOGICAL SERVICE.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor (student)

customer_reviews.title: DELL V515W - Walk on by...
customer_reviews.text: Slow, unreliable, ink hog. These are just three of the adjectives I have for this printer. As others have said, the wireless connection often requires a reboot of the laptop or the printer or both. I did not choose this printer, it was provided by my workplace. We expect better from Dell.
customer_reviews.author: bongiojf

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I had the same exact issue as everyone else did with this printer. We bought this printer exactly one year ago and the warranty expired in December. Printer head is now broken. It's not even worth replacing the printer head, I'm going to buy a whole new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Black Kitty

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: After a year of using this, I purchased 3 sets of ink. After changing the last ink cartridge, it will not print at all. Actually, the whole printer does not work at all. The scanner, fax or printer does nothing. All I have is a message, "There is a problem with your printheads, please consult User's guide." After contacting Dell Support, all they can tell me is, "there is a hardware problem, you should just buy a new printer." The customer service is crap, the printer is crap, DO NOT BUY! All I can do now is throw it away. Wasted my money and frustration for over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Luu

customer_reviews.title: Not a good printer
customer_reviews.text: We bought this printer almost a year ago and I have had nothing but trouble with it. The printer head stays broken and it is always getting paper jam. Cannot find the ink unless you order after market and it doesn't last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Simspon

customer_reviews.title: Hard Wire this one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for its wireless capability -- it has almost none. You have to reboot etc. to print. I hard wired it (printer cable) and it works fine -- except I have trouble getting it print both sides and have to do it manually -- OK but a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Not a good printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in Dec and the printer is now 7 months old and I just put it in the garbage. I didn't use it much, but then developed a problem with the printerhead...I took it apart did what they said at least 6 times...spent 3 hours....ENOUGH!! worst printer I ever had... will try another company, not Dell.
customer_reviews.author: pinkhammer

customer_reviews.title: This is the absolute worst printer ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst printer ever. If you want to be extremely frustrated, buy this printer. I will never buy a Dell printer again. The USB connection rarely even works. Don't even bother to try to use this as a network printer. Furthermore, Dell makes you download bloatware to get this thing "up and running". Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Boolites911

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This does everything! It was easy to set up and works without any problem. It was really a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Smith

customer_reviews.title: This printer is terrible, terrible, terrible
customer_reviews.text: This printer never has worked, I'm finally giving up on it and buying an HP. The Dell tech support is worthless unless you have an interpreter . It would make the perfect gift for your worst enemy.
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: WORST ALL IN ONE FAX ON THE PLANET!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS MACHINE IS HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ERROR MESSAGES NOT FIXABLE AND DELL SUGGEST YOU BUY A NEW ONE BECAUSE IT COSTS LESS TO BUY ANOTHER THAN FIX THIS ONE..
customer_reviews.author: IVEY

customer_reviews.title: DELL V515W
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer from DELL site, what a piece of garbage, and a waste of money. The first thing that happened was the printheads were defective, had them replaced by Dell, next the ink cartridges dont work, bought color cartrige and now the printer does not print in color, all the ink is spilling into the printer, Please dont waste your money on this printer buy HP from Amazon. I am now an official HP printer owner, never again buying Dell Printer.
customer_reviews.author: erdata

customer_reviews.title: Ink hog
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer exclusively for its wireless scanning and copy features. These both work flawlessly for me. I have tried printing a few pages, but the ink runs out really fast. This would be unusable as a main printer due to ink cost. This isn't a big deal to me because I own a monochrome laser printer which I use for printing (2500 pages per $20 toner drum is hard to argue with).
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Martin

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRINTER EVER
customer_reviews.text: I got it through work, thinking I would save money on my own printer. WRONG. It is a waste of time. ALMOST ALWAYS needs a reinstall or reboot to work on the network. For goodness' sake get a different printer.
customer_reviews.author: nthek

customer_reviews.title: awfull printer, awful servicw from dell
customer_reviews.text: Half the stuff doesnt work even if you use their manual. DONT BUY IT, ITS AN AWFUL EXPERIENCE JUST GOT HUNG UP BY DELL
customer_reviews.author: M. Bono

customer_reviews.title: By far this is the worst printer I've ever used -- save yourself some agony ...
customer_reviews.text: By far this is the worst printer I've ever used -- save yourself some agony and don't get one! Mine is going in the trash or going to be recycled because it is useless!
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this printer uses a lot of ink because I never printed enough with it because it never works!! Two big issues I have with it. 1) Always have issues connecting with it wirelessly. Reloaded software about 3-4 times and it still doesn't work. 2) Won't print even in B&W without a color cartridge that has some in. STUPID
customer_reviews.author: T. Meeks

customer_reviews.title: Form Belies Function
customer_reviews.text: This is without a doubt the worst printer I have ever had the misfortune to deal with. This "sleek" looking POS literally works half the time. I would not wish this sorry excuse for a "printer" on my worst enemy. Lithography is a more efficient use of time than this device.
customer_reviews.author: ArchiLogical

customer_reviews.title: The Worst I have had
customer_reviews.text: This printer has gone through two printer heads in 16 months. Quality of print is a joke and the Wireless always needs to be rebooted to work again. I have never been happy with it. I am getting the V715 is try it put. Not sure why i am sticking with Dell, but I am. One more chance. Printer ink has to be bought from Dell, cannot find it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: duncandog

customer_reviews.title: Worse printer ever
customer_reviews.text: Worse printer ever. I have this printer little over a year and I call it Mr. Worthless 20 pages and the ink is finish now it's not printing garbage
customer_reviews.author: Alcia R.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a piece of junk. In more than a year it has never worked care-free, constantly requiring to be turned off/on, unplugged and replugged, reboot the system. We didn't have one month of use from this printer that was without problems. And then the printhead broke. This is the last Dell printer we will purchase - it was by far the poorest product we have ever purchased, from any manufacturer, anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: krab76

customer_reviews.title: totally agree
customer_reviews.text: Agree with reviews. I bought this at the Dell site. It looses connectivity easily and runs through ink. It also does not recognize the ink cartridges that Dell says are compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of @$%$$%
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy a dell printer again.. Blury , printer head problems , no support... My mother inlaw recieved one the same time I did and the exact same problems.. stick with an HP
customer_reviews.author: scarud

customer_reviews.title: Worse Piece of Junk EVER
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the worse piece of junk I have ever bought in my entire life. It never works. I warn you . . do NOT buy this thing. It is a defective product. Based on my experience with this printer, I don't think I will ever buy another Dell product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the worse printer I have ever used. It doesn't half print and it uses way too much. We have had this printer for only a couple of months but we are already talking about buying a new one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever
customer_reviews.text: Never did anything besides give me problems. Did not work from day 1. Everything seems difficult for this printer. Don't buy it
customer_reviews.author: sbstrongbeach

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably horrible!
customer_reviews.text: It's mind boggling how pathetic this printer is. It has literally worked once, but only after having to get Dell to send a new part right off the bat. Now it won't connect to our computers wirelessly. It is useless!!! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: BCL

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about two years, and the printer head just broke. I just bought a hundred dollars worth of ink for this printer too!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Basically, it just doesn't work. I was able to print successfully one time, and after that I was never able to connect again. Unsurprisingly, Dell support was absolutely useless. What a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Renée

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: That should be the name of this printer - Dell Nightmare V515w. The wireless printing is a joke. I have to reinstall the printer every time I want to use it. Saddest buy from Dell, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kayelyn D.

product_meta.title: Dell All-in-One Wireless Printer (V515w)
product_meta.description:
Get more done in your busy day with the Dell V515w All-in-One Wireless Printer. It's the quick and easy way to print, scan, fax and copy with professional results. And do it all from the comfort of your own home or small office. With embedded wireless technology and a 35-page automatic document feeder, this printer gives you more time to focus on what's important - your life.

AMAZON.COM



Get more done in your busy day with the Dell V515w All-in-One Wireless Printer. It's the quick and easy way to print, scan, fax and copy with professional results. And do it all from the comfort of your own home or small office. With embedded wireless technology and a 35-page automatic document feeder, this printer gives you more time to focus on what's important--your life.



Print your own precise color photos and documents from virtually anywhere. Click here for a larger image

A PRODUCTIVITY BOOST FOR DAILY LIFE
Get more done in your busy day with the Dell V515w All-in-One Wireless Printer. It's the quick and easy way to print, scan, fax and copy with professional results. And do it all from the comfort of your own home or small office. With embedded wireless technology and a 35-page automatic document feeder, this printer gives you more time to focus on what's important--your life.

PROFESSIONAL IMAGE QUALITY
You've created a great proposal. Now it's easier than ever to turn your big ideas into professional-looking communications. The compact Dell V515w lets you print high-quality documents at high speed.

VIVID DETAIL
Print with outstanding grain and banding quality on various types of paper--all within a matter of moments. The Dell V515w delivers the sharpness you need to create first-class documents.

CONVENIENT PHOTO PRINTING
Print directly from your memory card using the built-in media card slots and PictBridge connectivity. Use the Nano Bluetooth Class 2 Dongle Network Adapter (sold separately) for sending photos from your camera wirelessly.

PRINT FROM ANYWHERE
With the Dell V515w, you can print from virtually anywhere within your wireless network. The printer comes with an embedded 802.11b/g wireless card, so you can easily share the device with other PCs. And you're no longer tied to working next to a printer on your desk--keep it in a closet, an extra bedroom or even in your garage.



Use the 2.4-inch color LCD display to navigate the menu and view, crop, or rotate images without turning on your PC. 



Enjoy the freedom of unrestricted, cable-free printing, or print directly from your memory card/camera. 



Conserve resources by enabling two-sided printing, dimming of the LCD display and standby Power Saving mode. 

NEARLY INSTANT GRATIFICATION
Print your critical documents within moments with the Dell V515w. Every aspect of this space-saving printer is designed to improve efficiency in your home or office.

FAST OUTPUT
Print professional-quality photos and documents unbelievably fast--up to 33 ppm in black and 30 ppm in color.

OPTICAL CHARACTER RECOGNITION
Turn your scanned text into an editable document with ABBYY FineReader Sprint Optical Character Recognition (OCR) software.

AUTOMATIC DOCUMENT FEEDER
Use the Automatic Document Feeder to copy, scan or fax up to 35 pages, without supervision. This saves you valuable time for other activities.

ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITY
Minimize your impact on the environment with these great features that come standard on the Dell V515w.

ECO MODE
Conserve resources by using the Eco Mode feature in the printer's setup software. You can set up the printer to dim the LCD display after 2 minutes of inactivity and go into Power Save mode after 10 minutes of nonuse. The energy savings can be substantial--as well as the cost savings.

CONVENIENT RECYCLING
Recycle your old printer with ease--a service that comes free with purchase. Dell also provides you with free postage-paid envelopes for recycling your ink cartridges.

ENERGY EFFICIENCY
Dell considers the environment in every aspect of the product lifecycle, from design and engineering to packaging and recycling. That's why the Dell V515w offers compliance with the latest standards, including WEEE, Energy Star and RoHS.

SIMPLE TO SERVICE
DELL INK MANAGEMENT SYSTEM
The Dell V515w is equipped with the Dell Ink Management System (DIMS) that proactively monitors your ink levels so you don't run out. Order ink online at anytime. (Refer to the Tech Tab for a list of replacement ink cartridges that work with this printer.)The Dell V515w inkjet printer includes both a Series 21 Single Use Standard Capacity Black and Series 21 Single Use Standard Capacity Color cartridge.

TECHNICAL SUPPORT
Get peace of mind with your purchase from Dell. The Dell V515w comes with a one-year limited hardware warranty and one-year Advanced Exchange service. Plus, you have the option to extend the coverage for 2–3 additional years.

ONLINE RESOURCES
Dell printers are also backed by online resources. The Dell Forums put you in touch with other users to exchange tips and ideas. Or, check out the Direct2Dell site for one-to-one communications with Dell.

V515W SPECS
WHAT'S IN THE BOX
V515w Printer, V515w User's Guide (Included on the Installation CD), Power Cord, Single Use Standard Capacity Color Cartridge, Single Use Standard Capacity Black Cartridge, Setup Instructions (Color Poster), Installation Software CD (Software and Drivers), Hardware Recycle Program, USB cable included
feature_bullets: Print, scan, copy and fax with one easy-to-use, compact device
Offers fast print speeds and 35-page automatic document feeder
Eco Mode provides valuable energy-saving capabilities
Built-in 802.11b/g wireless card for freedom in printing

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.7 out of 5 stars116 ratings2.7 out of 5 stars
